infos.value: There's the Crystal mine...
Why exactly are the Church of the Crystal followers after Crystals...?
We're not entirely sure of their motives.
...What do you mean?
Rundall's research on Crystals isn't very far along.
However, I've heard that Sadali is able to extract some sort of power from them...
...and uses it to produce various miracles, increasing his following in doing so.
Miracles? That's impossible...
Hard to believe? I felt the same way at first, too.
But Sadali does not show any signs of halting his pursuit of Crystals, even if it means taking on the risk of invading foreign nations.
There must be some secret that we aren't privy to hidden within the Crystals.
Hmph. It seems you've done a bit of research.
Commander...
From here, we storm the mining tunnel.
Commander, please pardon my suggestion, but perhaps we aught to ambush the enemy here...
What a cowardly proposal.
Now that I think about it, there is some sense to that plan.
But this may not be the only tunnel that connects to the mine.
It's possible that they would leave through a different exit while we lie here in wait.
If that were to happen, it would mean many Crystals falling into Sadali's hands.
I suppose that is true, but...
Our task is to eradicate the illegal miners.
The rest...goes without saying, no?
All right, everyone. Any mercy for Church of the Crystal followers will be unnecessary.
Take them down on sight.
Yes, sir.
Now, storm the mine!
Lu'Cia...
What the commander said makes sense. But still...
I have a bad feeling about this. Stick close to me, no matter what...
R-right.
